1: Seven women will take hold of one man[a] on that day, saying: “We will eat our own food and wear our own clothing; Only let your name be given us, put an end to our disgrace!”
2: [b]On that day, The branch[c] of the Lord will be beauty and glory, and the fruit of the land will be honor and splendor for the survivors of Israel.
3: Everyone who remains in Zion, everyone left in Jerusalem Will be called holy: everyone inscribed for life[d] in Jerusalem.
4: When the Lord washes away the filth of the daughters of Zion, And purges Jerusalem's blood from her midst with a blast of judgment, a searing blast,
5: Then will the Lord create, over the whole site of Mount Zion and over her place of assembly, A smoking cloud by day and a light of flaming fire by night.
6: For over all, his glory will be shelter and protection: shade from the parching heat of day, refuge and cover from storm and rain.
